r1bqkb1r/pppppppp/2n2n2/8/2PP4/4P3/PP3PP.explanation: Attack the center immediately. Since he played e3, he will most likely continue to play passive and try to lock down the position.

r1bqkb1r/pppppppp/2n2n2/8/2PP4/5N2/PP2PP.explanation: We can no longer push e5, so we settle for second best. We still open up our dark square bishop.

r1bqkb1r/pppp1ppp/2n2n2/3Pp3/2P5/4P3/PP3.explanation: We're rerouting the knight to g6, temporarily blocking our dark square bishop.

r1bqkb1r/ppppnppp/5n2/3Pp3/2P5/2N1P3/PP3.explanation: We've completed the rerouting and now have great defense for our king as well as potetial for a king side attack.

r1bqkb1r/pppp1ppp/5nn1/3Pp3/2P4P/2N1P3/P.explanation: Best to just stop the advancement. Bg5 is also currently not possible.

r1bqkb1r/pppp1pp1/5nn1/3Pp2p/2P4P/2NBP3/.explanation: Pin the knight so that in case he then develops Nf3, we have a fork.

r1bqk2r/pppp1pp1/5nn1/3Pp2p/1bP4P/2NBPN2.explanation: We double white's pawns and then fork him with e4.

r1b1k2r/ppppqpp1/5nn1/3Pp2p/1bP1P2P/2NB4.explanation: We give our dark square bishop a retreating square.

r1b1k2r/1pppqpp1/p4nn1/3Pp2p/1bP1P2P/P1N.explanation: We retreat the bishop and if the push continues, we go to a7.

r1b1k2r/1pppqpp1/p4nn1/2bPp2p/1PP1P2P/P1.explanation: We retreat the bishop on a nice diagonal. We also cannot be blocked by pawns here because we have both b7 and d7 breaks.

r1b1k2r/bpppqpp1/p4nn1/2PPp2p/1P2P2P/P1N.explanation: We break in order to free our dark square bishop.

r1b1k2r/bpp1qpp1/p2p1nn1/2PPp2p/QP2P2P/P.explanation: Our king is perfectly safe on f7. The opponent has the pawn chain and piece pointed towards the queen side.

opponentMoves: We trade off white's central knight.

r1b1k2r/bpp1qpp1/p2P1nn1/3Pp2p/1P2P2P/P1.explanation: We recapture with the queen in order to avoid the Bg5 pin.

r1bqkb1r/pppp1ppp/2n1pn2/8/2PP4/2N2N2/PP.explanation: Pin the knight. The dark square bishop doesn't have a lot of good square to go to anyway. If we trade it off, we will set up a dark square barricade.

r1bqk2r/pppp1ppp/2n1pn2/8/1bPP4/2N2N2/PP.explanation: We're preparing e5 push. If opponent pushes e4, we capture the knight.

r1bqk2r/ppp2ppp/2nppn2/8/1bPP4/2N1PN2/PP.explanation: We want control over the center. Not too much going on.

r1bqk2r/ppp2ppp/2np1n2/3Pp3/1bP5/2N1PN2/.explanation: We must capture the knight first because if we retreat our knight, there's a queen fork winning our bishop.

r1bqk2r/ppp2ppp/2np1n2/4P3/1bP5/2N1PN2/P.explanation: We recapture the pawn, gaining control of d4 and f4.

r1bqk2r/ppp2ppp/2np1n2/3Pp3/2P5/2Q1PN2/P.explanation: We have to retreat the knight under attack.

r1bqk2r/ppp2ppp/2np1n2/3Pp3/2P5/2P1PN2/P.explanation: We move our knight to safety and most likely end the journey to g6, unless there's an h pawn push.

r1bqk2r/ppp1nppp/3p1n2/3Pp3/1PP5/2Q1PN2/.explanation: We don't let white get too much space on the queen side. If he pushes b5, we can plant our knight on c5.

r1bqk2r/ppp1nppp/3p1n2/3Pp3/2P5/2Q1PN2/P.explanation: The idea is rerouting the knight to c5 and being protected from b4 push.
The idea is rerouting the knight to c5 and being protected from b4 push.

r1bqk2r/ppp1nppp/3p1n2/3Pp3/2P5/2QBPN2/P.explanation: We have a game winning fork.

r1bqk2r/ppp2ppp/2n2n2/4p3/1bP5/2N1PN2/PP.explanation: We force the knight to move.
We reinforce the e4 pawn push in case of Bd3. It's not a fork anymore, but it leads to an interesting position.

r1b1k2r/ppp1qppp/2n2n2/4p3/1bP5/P1N1PN2/.explanation: We fall back because the white piece are very crammed and we have easy development and space and can easily counter queen side push. From here, we mainly expand with a5 and e4.

r1b1k2r/ppp1qppp/2n2n2/4p3/1bP5/2N1PN2/P.explanation: Punish white for playing so passively.

Nd4.explanation: We don't care about double pawns. In case he castles long, we will have an open b file. If he castles short, we have create a battery with Bd6 Qe5

r1b1k2r/ppp1qppp/2n2n2/6N1/1bP1p3/2N1P3/.explanation: It looks like we're losing the e4 pawn, but we can always capture the knight to remove a defender.

r1b2rk1/ppp1qppp/2n2n2/6N1/1bP1p3/P1N1P3.explanation: We want to remove a defender of e4 anyway.

r1b2rk1/ppp1qppp/2n2n2/6N1/2P1p3/P1B1P3/.explanation: We centralize the rook and add a defender to e4.

r1b1r1k1/ppp1qppp/2n2n2/6N1/2P1p2P/P1B1P.explanation: Develop the light square bishop and add another defender to e4.

r3r1k1/ppp1qppp/2n2n2/5b2/2P1p2P/P1B1P2N.explanation: Centralize the rook, prevent long castling.

r3r1k1/ppp1qppp/2n2n2/5bNP/2P1p3/P1B1P3/.explanation: Let him push, we focus on development.

3rr1k1/ppp1qp1p/2n2npP/5bN1/2P1p3/P1B1P3.explanation: Remember than now he always has lolli mate available, so we might need to use our queen to protect the diagonal.
We open up a discovered attack on the knight as well as open the diagonal for our queen.

3rr1k1/ppp1qp1p/2n2npP/5bN1/2P1p3/PQB1P3.explanation: There's no better way to defend that pawn. We need to be careful now that our knight is undefended. We can centralize it or defend it with a move like Rd6 and stack the rooks.

3rr1k1/ppp1qp1p/2n2npP/5b2/2P1p3/P1B1P2N.explanation: We centralize our knight and get ready to bring the other knight closer to enemy king. From here, if our knight gets captured, we recapture with the queen.

3rr1k1/ppp1qp1p/2n2npP/5bN1/2P1p3/P1B1P3.explanation: We open up a discovered attack on the knight as well as open the diagonal for our queen.

3Rr1k1/ppp1qp1p/2n3pP/5bN1/2P1p1n1/P1B1P.explanation: We capture with the queen because the queen will go to h4 most likely and we want to leave the rook guarding the e4 pawn.

3rr1k1/ppp1qp1p/2n3pP/5b2/2P1p1n1/P1B1P2.explanation: We get the other knight in a fighting position. From here, we have several options: Nf3+, Rxd1, Qh4. We just need to be mindful of the a1-h8 diagonal.

3rr1k1/ppp1qp1p/2n3pP/5bN1/2P1p1B1/P1B1P.explanation: We don't want to capture the knight because we want to pin it when it goes h3.

3qr1k1/ppp2p1p/2n3pP/5bN1/2P1p1B1/P1B1P3.explanation: We don't want to capture the knight because we want to pin it when it goes h3.

3qr1k1/ppp2p1p/2n3pP/5b2/2P1p1n1/P1B1P2N.explanation: We pin the knight to the rook and the f2 pawn to the king. From here, we can centralize our other knight and then we have various knight sacrifices.

3qr1k1/ppp2p1p/2n3pP/8/2P1p1b1/P1B1P2N/1.explanation: We pin the knight to the rook and the f2 pawn to the king. From here, we just need to be careful about backrank mate.

3rr1k1/ppp1qp1p/2n3pP/5b2/2P1p1n1/P1B1P2.explanation: Get rid of the future lolli mate possibility

3rr1k1/ppp1qp1p/2n3pP/5bN1/2P1p1B1/P1B1P.explanation: We capture with the bishop because the opponent's knight doesn't have good places to go to.

3rr1k1/ppp1qp1p/2n3pn/5b2/2P1pN2/P1B1P3/.explanation: We need to bring the knight to e5 because otherwise white can make a deadly combo between knight on d5 and bishop on the a1-h8 diagonal. From here, if the bishop ever takes, we recapture with queen, if knight attacks us we bring queen to g5.

3rr1k1/ppp1qp1p/2n3pP/8/2P1p1b1/P1B1P2N/.explanation: We bring the queen closer to the king for an attack.

3rr1k1/ppp1qp1p/2n3pP/8/2P1N1b1/P1B1P3/1.explanation: We recapture and have a two piece advantage.

3rr1k1/ppp1qppp/2n2n2/5b2/2P1pN1P/P1B1P3.explanation: Centralize the knight and prevent Nd5 and dark square bishop teaming up.

3rr1k1/ppp1qppp/2n2n2/5b2/2P1p2P/PQB1P2N.explanation: We allow the queen to capture on b7 because we follow-up with Nd3+

3rr1k1/ppp1qppp/2n2n2/5b2/2P1p2P/P1B1P2N.explanation: Centralize the knight and prepare to bring the other knight to g4 in case white plays passive.
Double his pawns, open up his king.

3rr1k1/ppp1qppp/5n2/4nb2/2P1pN1P/P1B1P3/.explanation: We move the knight in an attacking position. We also have a discovered attack on h4

3rr1k1/pQp1qppp/5n2/4nb2/2P1p2P/P1B1P2N/.explanation: King is forced to move. Recapturing leads to even bigger advantage.

3rr1k1/pQp1qppp/5n2/5b2/2P1p2P/P1BBP2N/1.explanation: From here, we centralize the knight and push d2. Just be careful about Nd5

3rr1k1/pQp2ppp/5n2/4qb2/2P1p2P/P3P2N/1P2.explanation: We force the queen to move and we infiltrate.

3rr1k1/ppp2ppp/5n2/4qb2/2P1pN1P/PQ2P3/1P.explanation: The bishop isn't very useful right now because h pawn is pushed and e4 pawn is blocking the other diagonal, so we want to trade it. Qxh7 is always met with Rb8

3rr1k1/ppp2ppp/5n2/4q3/2P1pNBP/PQ2P3/1P3.explanation: Take and put the knight in a more aggressive position.

3rr1k1/ppp2ppp/8/4q3/2P1pNnP/PQ2P3/1P3PP.explanation: Force a move. If queen recapture, we can take on b2. If the king recaptures, we have a fork.

3rr1k1/ppp1qppp/8/4nb2/2P1pNnP/P1B1P1P1/.explanation: Our knight is currently not capturable by either minor pieces. From here, we have sacrifices and forks possible, and improving moves like h6, a6, c6

3rr1k1/ppp1qppp/8/4nb2/2P1pNBP/P1B1P3/1P.explanation: We recapture with the knight so that the queen continues to guard e4 pawn. From here, we have improving moves like c6, f6, h6, a6

3rr1k1/ppp1qppp/8/4Bb2/2P1pNnP/P3P3/1PQ1.explanation: We recapture with the knight and the plan is to put the knight on d3, unless the rook moves over. From here, we have improving moves like g6 to guard the bishop, stacking rook on the d file, a6, c6, etc

3rr1k1/ppp1qppp/5n2/4nb2/2P1p2P/P1B1P2N/.explanation: Double his pawns, open up his king. We will most likely draw, but white has 1-2 double pawns, so should be easier. Don't forget about backrank mate.

3Rr1k1/ppp1qppp/5n2/4nb2/2P1p2P/P1B1P2N/.explanation: We retake with rook because we want queen to keep protecting the e file. We will most likely centralize queen at some point in the future.

3rr1k1/ppp2ppp/5n2/4qb2/2P1p2P/P3P2N/1PQ.explanation: Double his pawns, open up his king. We will most likely draw, but white has 1-2 double pawns, so should be easier. Don't forget about backrank mate.

3Rr1k1/ppp2ppp/5n2/4qb2/2P1p2P/P3P2N/1PQ.explanation: Retake. We still have a rook on the open file. If the opponent tries to trade the second one.

3rr1k1/ppp2ppp/5n2/4qb2/2P1pN1P/P3P3/1PQ.explanation: No matter how opponent blocks, we gain something. From here, slowly march into opponent's position.

3r2k1/ppp2ppp/5n2/4qb2/2P1pN1P/P3P3/1PQ1.explanation: No matter how opponent blocks, we gain something. From here, slowly march into opponent's position.

3r2k1/ppp2ppp/5n2/4qb2/2P1p2P/P3P2N/1PQ1.explanation: Double his pawns, open up his king. We will most likely draw, but white has 1-2 double pawns, so should be easier. Don't forget about backrank mate.

3r2k1/p1p2ppp/1p3n2/4qb2/2P1p2P/PQ2P2N/1.explanation: We no longer have connected rooks, so we defend the pawn the old fashioned way.
Double his pawns, open up his king. We will most likely draw, but white has 1-2 double pawns, so should be easier. Don't forget about backrank mate.

3r2k1/p1p2ppp/1p3n2/4qb2/2P1pN1P/PQ2P3/1.explanation: Improving move, defending our bishop in case e4 pawn gets out of the picture. We have Qa5+, c5. It's better to trade bishop on g4 due to e4 pawn blocking the diagonal.

3r2k1/ppp1qppp/5n2/4nb2/2P1p2P/P1B1P2N/1.explanation: Open up the king and give the opponent doubled h pawns.

3r2k1/ppp1qppp/5n2/4nb2/2P1pN1P/P1B1P3/1.explanation: We plant the knight on d3 from where it's very hard to get rid of.

3r2k1/ppp2ppp/5n2/4qb2/2P1p2P/P3P2N/1PQ1.explanation: Open up the king and give the opponent doubled h pawns.

3r2k1/ppp2ppp/5n2/4qb2/2P1p2P/PQ2P2N/1P2.explanation: No better way to guard the pawns since we don't have double rooks anymore. The good news is that a and c pawns are much harder to attack. From here, we start advancing pawns: c5, g6, h6

3r2k1/ppp2ppp/5n2/4qb2/2P1pN1P/P3P3/1PQ1.explanation: No matter how opponent blocks, we gain something. From here, slowly march into opponent's position.

3r2k1/ppp2ppp/5n2/4q3/2P1p2P/P3P2P/1PQ1B.explanation: We make luft for our king. From here, we have pressure on b2 if queen moves. Opponent has double pawns. GL

3r2k1/ppp1qppp/5n2/4n3/2P1p2P/P1B1P2P/1P.explanation: We plant the knight on d3 from where it's very hard to get rid of. We manuever our queen to d7 -> f5.

3rr1k1/ppp1qppp/2n2n2/8/2P1p2P/P1B1P2P/1.explanation: Centralize the knight. There's now always Nf3+ and centralizing the other knight.

r3r1k1/ppp1qppp/5n2/4nbNP/2P1p3/P1B1P3/1.explanation: We outpost our knight and the best move and there's no good move for the opponent.
